comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: 4.0.1

Hello,

I found a bug quite disturbing, visually ...

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Visit my personal website
2. Click on the red tab
3. Wiggle the mouse

Actual Results:  
Until you move the mouse, Javascript timeouts seem to freeze.

Expected Results:  
As timeouts have a process detached from events, as is the case in Chrome and IE
comments.author: lcf.vs@hotmail.com
comments.text:

What exactly is the problem you see? Fx not showing up the animation?

Check on the version of your choice ;)

Not knowing if my explanation to you yesterday was clear enough, I'll put it another way.

The problem lies in the fact it appears that there when Firefox detects an event related to the mouse, it is paused timeouts.

In my opinion, this has no rationale, if one wanted such a behavior, it should be generated by the script and not by default the browser.
comments.creator: lcf.vs@hotmail.com

comments.raw_text:
Firefox does not pause timeouts when it is handling mouse events.

So far I haven't manage to reproduce this. I've tested on Linux and Windows7
(I'm using nightly builds for testing. http://nightly.mozilla.org/)
The animation stays smooth even if I move mouse over the animated menu.

Do you happen to have some addons which might slow down browser?
Skype's addon for example?

comments.creator: george.carstoiu@gmail.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 541059
Screenshot 1

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110621 Firefox/7.0a1

The animation seems really fluid - no problems there.

Another thing concerns me - the text-area fields from the menu are too long and they go out of the designated menu area. I tried this on both Opera and Chrome and they show the areas withing the borders of the menu. See Screenshot 1 for a better understanding.
comments.author: george.carstoiu@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110621 Firefox/7.0a1

The animation seems really fluid - no problems there.

Another thing concerns me - the text-area fields from the menu are too long and they go out of the designated menu area. I tried this on both Opera and Chrome and they show the areas withing the borders of the menu. See Screenshot 1 for a better understanding.

comments.raw_text:
Hi,

Thanks for your interest on these bugs. :)

Personally, I do not have this bug button too large, however, it allowed me to better understand the origin of the slowdown in the animation.

This slowdown occurs when moving the mouse over an item that was added a clipPath.

example:
http://lcfvs.monespace.net/perso/bugzilla.xhtml

If you move fast enough the mouse cursor over the red square, as it descends, it is altogether stop the animation!

comments.author: bogdan.maris@softvision.com
comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:25.0) Gecko/20130730 Firefox/25.0
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:25.0) Gecko/20130731 Firefox/25.0
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh: Intel Mac OS X 10.9; rv:25.0) Gecko/20130731 Firefox/25.0

Tested on latest Nightly (buildID: 20130730030204)
On Mac OS X 10.9 the animation is as fast on Nightly as in Chrome, Opera, Safari.
On Ubuntu 12.04 x32 the animation is as fast as on Chrome, and faster then Opera.
On Windows 7 x 32 the animation is two times slower on Nightly then Chrome, Opera, IE.
comments.creator: bogdan.maris@softvision.com
